Experts advocate for a substantial, sustained hike in defence capital expenditure, emphasizing domestic manufacturing and technological advancement. While geopolitical tensions necessitate increased spending, the focus must be on strategic calibration rather than indiscriminate increases to bolster national security and industrial capabilities.

This growth was primarily driven by a significant reduction in provisions, despite margins facing pressure. The bank saw healthy deposit and advance growth, with asset quality continuing its upward trend.

He stated that over 70,000 ration cards and 500,000 pensions were stopped in six months due to minor errors in Family IDs, with Haryana leading national cancellations.

articles.title: Savarkar Sadan cannot be declared a centrally protected monument: ASI tells HC
articles.summary: The ASI told Bombay High Court that Savarkar Sadan can't be a national monument as it's under 100 years old, but can be state protected.

articles.title: Trade deals, diversification to strengthen exports momentum
articles.summary: India's export scene is on the rise! With promising trade negotiations underway with the United States and fresh partnerships forming around the globe, the outlook is remarkably optimistic. Even in the face of rising global protectionism, India's trade figures have outperformed projections. This acceleration is powered by significant structural reforms and strategic policy initiatives.

articles.summary: Indian government’s move to mandate labelling of AI-generated content seeks to empower users to scrutinise such content and ensure that synthetic output is not masquerading as truth, IT Secretary S Krishnan had recently said at an event, and informed that the rules are now nearing finalisation.

It will focus on impact, accessibility, and safety. Policymakers, industry leaders, and investors will attend. This summit will strengthen India's position as a trusted global AI partner.

articles.summary: Samir Bodas, cofounder, and former CEO of enterprise software firm Icertis, has passed away after battling with cancer, the company said on Thursday.

articles.title: Economic Survey 2026 flags high distribution costs as key drag on insurance penetration
articles.summary: The Economic Survey 2025–26 warns high distribution costs are limiting India’s insurance growth, causing low penetration despite rising premiums and density, and urges digitisation to boost inclusion.

articles.title: National Mission on Manufacturing aims to double manufacturing contribution to GDP by 2035
articles.summary: India's National Mission on Manufacturing targets a significant boost by 2035. The plan aims to double the manufacturing sector's contribution to GDP to 25 percent. It also seeks to create 143 million new jobs. Merchandise exports are projected to reach USD 1.2 trillion. This initiative focuses on strategic sector development and improving business conditions.

articles.summary: Despite tax relief, personal income tax will outpace corporate taxes, driven by rapid base expansion, compliance, and technology-led administration, cementing individuals as India’s largest contributor.

articles.title: Karnataka police personnel to be granted leave on birthdays, anniversaries
articles.summary: Granting leave on these special days helps officers and staff rejuvenate emotionally, spend quality time with their families, and maintain a healthy balance between professional duties and personal life, the circular said.

articles.title: CRED posts 16% jump in FY25 revenue, narrowing losses on broader product adoption
articles.summary: CRED said engagement on its platform increased during the year, with monthly transacting users rising 14.5% to 12.6 million.

articles.title: Why does Elon Musk want to put AI data centers in space?
articles.summary: Space-based data centers - still an ‌early-stage concept - would likely rely ‌on hundreds of solar-powered satellites networked in orbit to handle the enormous computing demands of AI systems like xAI's Grok or OpenAI's ChatGPT, at a time when energy-hungry Earth-based facilities are ‌becoming increasingly costly to run.

articles.title: SIP inflows jump seven-fold over past decade; household savings shift towards mutual funds: Economic Survey
articles.summary: Economic Survey 2025-26: SIPs boost mutual fund growth in India, assets reach ₹80 lakh crore, 5.9 crore investors shift savings to equities.

articles.summary: The Justice Department on Friday said it has released thousands of files on sex financier and convicted trafficker Jeffrey Epstein

articles.title: Andaman-Nicobar a key destination for exploration, says Oil India chief
articles.summary: Ranjit Rath says geological parallels with prolific Southeast Asian basins and improved subsurface data underpin Oil India’s confidence in Andaman exploration.

articles.title: Kajaria Ceramics Q3: Margin expands sharply despite modest revenue growth
articles.summary: Kajaria Ceramics Q3FY26 net profit rose 9 percent to ₹86.1 crore, driven by strong margins. Board approved full acquisition of Kajaria Adhesives and Kajaria Surfaces, and appointed Vinit Kumar.

articles.title: CEA Nageswaran says Eco Survey 2026 highlights India as ‘an oasis of stability’ in an edgy world
articles.summary: V Anantha Nageswaran highlights India as an oasis of macro stability as reflected in the Economic Survey 2025–26, with strong growth, benign inflation, robust public finances and a resilient external sector.

articles.title: You may donate online via danamojo.
Google cofounder seeds billionaire political effort amid wealth tax debate
articles.summary: Sergey Brin, a Google cofounder and one of the wealthiest people in the world, is donating $20 million to a new California political drive weeks after he took steps to leave the state to avoid a possible billionaire tax.

articles.title: Combining SpaceX with xAI may be simple for Musk, but Tesla isn't so easy
articles.summary: Elon Musk fans and the man himself have long mused about Musk Inc, a merger of companies owned by the world's richest man. But with ‍SpaceX expected to go public later this year, and Tesla facing ​a challenging transition from human-driven EVs to robotaxis and robots, even some proponents of a sprawling Musk conglomerate want to start smaller.

articles.title: From search to shopping carts, digital ads mint Rs 80,000 crore
articles.summary: Indian tech and ecommerce companies earned close to Rs 80,000 crore in ad revenue in 2024-25. Digital advertising fueled this growth as brands sought measurable results. Google and Meta lead with strong performance. Retail media platforms like Amazon and Flipkart also saw significant gains. This trend highlights a shift in advertising budgets towards data-driven digital channels.

articles.title: Paytm ups focus on consumer payments as profits stabilise, revenues grow
articles.summary: Addressing stock market analysts a day after the company declared its December quarter results, Paytm chief executive Vijay Shekhar Sharma said the company is working on building consumer products. The management is also working on making its stockbroking entity, Paytm Money, among the country’s top five brokers in the next three years.

articles.title: How instant UPI apps change small-value payment habits
articles.summary: The rise of instant UPI apps has revolutionized small-value transactions, eliminating the struggle for exact change and streamlining checkout processes. This speed has fostered a subconscious habit of frequent, smaller digital purchases, altering consumer behavior and empowering micro-economies. The digital footprint created enhances financial literacy and formalizes the informal sector.

articles.title: Sandisk forecasts profit surge, secures supply deal as AI fuels storage demand
articles.summary: The data storage firm forecast fiscal third-quarter revenue with a midpoint of $4.6 billion and adjusted profit with a midpoint of $14 ‌per share. ‌Both were above estimates of $2.77 billion and $4.37 apiece, respectively, according to LSEG-compiled data.

articles.title: South Korean police to question interim CEO of Coupang in data breach probe
articles.summary: Interim Chief Executive Harold Rogers pledged to cooperate with all probes into the data leak.

articles.title: Facebook India net jumps 28% in FY25
articles.summary: Revenue from operations rose 25.0% to Rs 3,793 crore from Rs 3,035 crore a year earlier. Total income increased 25.2% to Rs 3,834 crore from Rs 3,064 crore. Total expenses for the year climbed 22.6% to Rs 2,881 crore, compared with Rs 2,350 crore in the previous fiscal. Employee benefit expenses jumped 36.3% to Rs 649 crore from Rs 476 crore.

articles.title: Google India net inches up in FY25
articles.summary: Net profit rose 0.8% to Rs 1,437 crore in FY25 from Rs 1,425 crore in the previous fiscal. Revenue from operations declined 3.2% to Rs 5,340 crore compared with Rs 5,518 crore a year earlier. Total income, however, increased 3.3% to Rs 6,116 crore from Rs 5,921 crore.

articles.title: Ex-Google engineer convicted of stealing AI secrets for Chinese companies
articles.summary: Linwei Ding, a 38-year-old Chinese ‌national, was ‌found guilty after an 11-day trial of seven counts of economic espionage and seven counts ‌of theft of trade secrets for stealing thousands of pages of confidential information.

articles.title: Elon Musk's SpaceX in merger talks with xAI ahead of planned IPO, source says
articles.summary: Musk, the world's richest man, is the CEO of both the private space company SpaceX and the artificial intelligence company xAI, which controls his social ‌media platform X. He also runs ‌electric automaker Tesla, tunnel company The Boring Co. and neurotechnology company Neuralink.

articles.title: Apple warns memory costs are starting to bite as Samsung, SK Hynix prioritise AI chips
articles.summary: Apple will likely need more and ‌more memory chips as demand for its latest iPhone 17 has surged, especially in China and India. Cook called demand for the device in the December quarter "staggering," but declined to answer a question from an analyst on whether Apple might raise product pricing because of the paucity of memory chips.

articles.title: Quick commerce march trampling on ecommerce toes
articles.summary: India’s quick commerce grocery delivery is rapidly eating into ecommerce sales, which are being disrupted more than kirana stores. Quick commerce now accounts for nearly half of online grocery sales and is set to dominate two-thirds by 2030. Ecommerce firms are adapting, with many shifting towards quick commerce models.

articles.title: Rising digital addiction prompts call for age-based online access
articles.summary: Screen impact addictive use of smartphones, gaming and social media linked to lost study hours, lower productivity, sleep disruption and rising stress across age groups.

articles.title: Is chip giant ASML about to hit a ceiling, or break through it?
articles.summary: ASML shares are up 34% so ‌far this month and ‌trade at 42 times 2026 earnings estimates, well above Nvidia's 25 times, as analysts have ratcheted up forecasts. ASML management sees sales growth this year ranging from as low ‌as 4% to as high as 19%.

articles.title: Banned to back again: A timeline of TikTok's rise, fall and rebirth
articles.summary: TikTok evolved from a teen dance app into a dominant US platform shaping culture, commerce and politics.

articles.title: Economic Survey 2025-26 for age bar for social media access, cutting online classes
articles.summary: India's Economic Survey 2025-26 highlights digital addiction as a growing concern. It proposes age-based online access limits and reduced online teaching. Schools will play a key role in digital wellness education. Simpler devices for children are recommended to prevent exposure to harmful content. The survey calls for comprehensive interventions to address the mental health impacts of digital addiction.

articles.title: Health beats motor as India's leading non-life insurance segment
articles.summary: India’s non-life insurance sector has seen strong growth, with health insurance surpassing motor as the largest segment, though overall coverage remains limited, the Economic Survey said. Rising premiums, healthcare costs, vehicle sales, and asset ownership are key drivers. Insurers are urged to digitise distribution and cut costs to improve penetration and market reach.

articles.title: Swiggy sees 20.5% YoY growth in food delivery order value
articles.summary: Food and grocery delivery platform Swiggy reported that its food gross order value (GOV) has accelerated, clocking 20.5% year-on-year (YoY) growth in the December quarter.

articles.title: Swiggy flags quick commerce growth impact from irrational competition, bulk order cannibalisation
articles.summary: Swiggy said fierce and often "irrational" competition slowed order growth at Instamart, especially for low average order value (AOV) segments. Losses widened as the company avoided deep discounts and low-margin volumes, despite strong growth in total order value. Swiggy prioritised sustainable demand over short-term gains, even as rivals cut prices aggressively.

articles.title: Inflation basket rejig: AirPods gain weight, food portion cut
articles.summary: India's inflation measurement is getting a significant upgrade. New items like AirPods and hand sanitisers are joining the Consumer Price Index. The base year is shifting to 2024 from 2012. This overhaul aims to provide a more accurate picture of price changes. The changes will help the Reserve Bank of India make better monetary policy decisions.

articles.title: Strong domestic private sector investment key to attract net FDI inflows to India: Raghuram Rajan
articles.summary: Raghuram Rajan: When asked whether he thinks it is very odd for capital to be fleeing from a country where economic growth at 7.4 per cent (FY26) is much greater than anywhere in the world, he said: "Well, FDI would come in if your private sector were also investing, but your private sector is not investing."

articles.title: Metals meltdown: Here's the post-crash roadmap for gold and silver
articles.summary: Gold, silver price crash: Gold and silver ETFs saw a significant drop as investors locked in profits after a sharp pullback from record highs. This volatility follows an extraordinary January rally, sparking debate on whether it signals a buying opportunity or the end of an exceptional surge. Experts offer divergent views on the metals' future trajectory.

articles.title: Economic Survey breaks new ground by putting cities at centre of growth: Anand Mahindra
articles.summary: The Economic Survey's focus on cities as economic engines marks a significant policy shift, according to Anand Mahindra. For the first time, urban areas are recognized as core growth platforms, not just sites of problems. This approach, prioritizing liveability and integrated planning, could unlock India's potential for sustained development.

articles.title: India needs to make the most out of its premium love
articles.summary: Union Budget 2026: India's consumption is shifting towards premium products, with consumers confidently purchasing higher-value goods like expensive smartphones and SUVs. This trend, evident in macro data, presents both opportunities and challenges for policymakers. The Union Budget must now focus on fostering domestic value creation and strengthening local supply chains to align with this evolving consumer behavior.

articles.title: India’s economy running a marathon & challenges sprinting too: Swaminathan Aiyar
articles.summary: India's economy is set for strong growth, exceeding expectations. The Economic Survey highlights rising productivity as a key driver. However, concerns remain about private investment and the impact of freebie culture. Global uncertainties loom, but India is seen as well-positioned due to its domestic market and reserves. The nation must balance growth with resilience.

articles.title: Formal skilling could boost jobs by 13%, says Economic Survey
articles.summary: India needs more formal skill training. The Economic Survey highlights this, suggesting a boost in skilled workers could significantly increase jobs. A unified apprenticeship mission is proposed, combining existing schemes. This aims to streamline training and attract more youth. Industry partnerships and policy reforms are key to building a future-ready workforce.

articles.title: Economic Survey turns bullish on growth, cautions on uncertainty: Aditi Nayar, ICRA
articles.summary: The revised potential growth estimate also anchors the survey's FY27 growth projection of 6.8-7.2%. It lays out three scenarios mapping global developments and the transmission of uncertainty to the Indian economy, a prudent approach given the scale of external volatility seen in 2025.

articles.title: Global Business Summit to discuss India’s path to a $10-trillion economy
articles.summary: New Delhi will host the ET NOW Global Business Summit 2026 on February 13-14. Policymakers and business leaders will discuss India's ambition to become a $10 trillion economy by 2047. The summit will focus on resilience and growth amidst global trade uncertainties. Discussions will cover strategic defence, semiconductors, clean energy, and digital sovereignty.

articles.title: Economic Survey: Pvt capital, climate tech key to fixing farm productivity
articles.summary: The challenges facing India's agriculture sector are significant, encompassing issues like fragmented land ownership and vulnerabilities to climate change. To combat these obstacles, the Economic Survey suggests innovative approaches such as adopting climate-smart farming practices and enhancing market connectivity for farmers. There's a crucial need for the private sector to step up in areas like food manufacturing and distribution.

articles.title: Economic Survey: Going green & orange, and in the pink of health
articles.summary: India's economy is poised for growth with proposed reforms. Opening heritage sites for concerts and easing artist visas will boost the concert economy. MSMEs will get better credit access. E-way bills will be simplified for smoother logistics. Dietary reforms are crucial for public health. Industrial clusters will be modernized. Commodity prices are expected to rise.

articles.title: Economic Survey flags strong growth ahead for India’s aviation, ports and shipping sectors by FY31
articles.summary: India's civil aviation and ports sectors are poised for substantial growth by FY31, fueled by increasing demand and infrastructure investments. The Economic Survey highlights India's low airport density compared to global benchmarks, indicating significant expansion potential. Ports are also scaling up, with PPP and captive operators expected to manage 80% of cargo by 2030.

articles.title: Manufacturing boost: Three cheers for 3-tier Swadeshi approach
articles.summary: India can boost domestic manufacturing in key sectors like oils, pulses, and pharmaceuticals. Other areas like battery cells and solar wafers need a gradual approach. The nation should focus on 'intelligent indigenisation' to build resilience and integrate globally. This strategy aims to strengthen manufacturing and lower costs. The focus is on strategic urgency, feasibility, and cost-effectiveness for long-term competitiveness.

articles.title: NSE's MD and CEO urged entrepreneurs to tap into India's capital market, 'Time has come'
AmEx projects upbeat 2026 profit as affluent spending holds up; shares dip
articles.summary: American Express forecast annual profit largely above Wall Street expectations on Friday, underscoring resilient spending by its young and affluent customers, but a small miss on holiday-quarter profit weighed on its shares.

articles.title: Budget 2026: Indian stock market to stay open on Sunday, February 1 — only the second time in history
articles.summary: Indian stock markets will open on Sunday, February 1, 2026, for the Union Budget — only the second Sunday trading session in independent India. Exchanges will follow regular hours as FM Nirmala Sitharaman presents Budget 2026. Historically, Budget days see muted market moves, with bigger trends emerging afterwards.

articles.title: Gainers & Losers: Vodafone among 7 big movers on Friday. Here’s what triggered them
articles.summary: Indian equity benchmarks snapped a three-day rally on Friday amid selling in metals and IT. Hindustan Copper and Vedanta fell sharply, while Vodafone Idea, Nestle India and GRSE gained following earnings, management updates and strategic announcements.

articles.title: Ambuja Cements Q3: Profit slumps 91% YoY to Rs 204 crore; revenue jumps 20%
articles.summary: Ambuja's volume growth was 2X the industry average, with a higher focus on trade sales/premium cement, which delivered better realisations than peers, along with higher volume growth of base capacity. The total cement capacity stood at 109 MTPA.

articles.title: NALCO posts rise in quarterly profit on higher aluminium prices
articles.summary: India's National Aluminium Company (NALCO) reported a marginal increase ‍in third-quarter profit on Friday, ​helped by firm aluminium prices.

articles.title: Silver sinks below $100, gold breaks $5,000 as dollar jumps on Fed nominee report
articles.summary: Silver and gold prices have seen a sharp decline. This follows a period of record highs for both precious metals. The drop is attributed to a strengthening US dollar. Expectations of a new Federal Reserve chair appointment are boosting the dollar. This is impacting the prices of safe-haven assets like gold and silver.

articles.title: Silver cracks 17%, falls nearly Rs 70,000 in a single day! Time to book profit or stay invested?
articles.summary: Silver’s record-breaking rally hit a sudden pause as March futures plunged nearly Rs 70,000, slipping below Rs 4 lakh after a 74% surge this month. Analysts say momentum remains bullish but warn of extreme overbought conditions, rising volatility, and elevated risks, prompting investors to weigh profit-booking against staying invested.

articles.title: EMS valuations, oil plays and Paytm in focus as Sabharwal stays cautious ahead of Budget
articles.summary: Market expert Sandip Sabharwal expressed caution on high-valuation EMS stocks like Dixon Technologies, questioning earnings quality and growth sustainability. He offered a tactical view on oil stocks such as ONGC, citing cheap valuations, and maintained a guarded stance on Paytm due to structural challenges and low-PE business models.

articles.title: JJG Aero raises $30 million from Norwest to scale capacity
articles.summary: Aerospace components maker JJG Aero has raised $30 million in funding led by Norwest, marking the investor’s first bet in the segment in India. The company plans to expand manufacturing capacity as global aircraft demand remains strong. Industry leaders say India offers major growth potential in aerospace manufacturing.

articles.title: Reliance leads $50 million round in spacetech startup Digantara at $200 million valuation
articles.summary: Reliance Industries has led a $50 million funding round in spacetech startup Digantara, valuing the firm at about $200 million. The Bengaluru-based company tracks satellites and space debris using its own space-based technology and plans global expansion. The funding will support overseas growth, satellite manufacturing and higher production capacity.

articles.title: ETtech Deals Digest: Startups raise $777 million in January so far; down 14% on-year
articles.summary: Startups across multiple stages raised the funds through 112 deals, compared to 210 in the year-ago period.

articles.title: India to expand AI training to 500 universities under AI Mission 2.0
articles.summary: The Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology announced a new plan to expand artificial intelligence training to 500 universities across the country. This initiative aims to create a talent pipeline for the industry by providing specialised course curriculum and training opportunities for students. The program follows a model used in the semiconductor sector, where students at 315 universities are already designing chips.

articles.title: Indian IT industry shifting from software to AI-driven solution: Ashwini Vaishnaw
Chinese AI chipmaker Axera Semiconductor to raise $379 million via Hong Kong IPO
articles.summary: The proceeds are earmarked for upgrading its technology platform and developing new products, as well as sales expansion, potential equity investments or acquisitions and working ‌capital and ‌general corporate purposes, the filing said.

articles.title: Amazon and Google eat into Nvidia's AI chip supremacy
articles.summary: A wide variety of chipmakers have spent years trying to compete with Nvidia, including old-guard companies like Advanced Micro Devices, startups like Cerebras and tech giants like Microsoft and Meta. But the growing chip businesses at Amazon and Google are Nvidia's toughest competition.

articles.title: Amazon in talks to invest billions in OpenAI, source says
articles.summary: Big Tech companies are racing to forge partnerships with OpenAI, betting that closer ‌ties with the artificial-intelligence startup would give them a competitive edge in the AI race.

articles.title: Apple acquires Israeli audio AI startup Q.ai
articles.summary: Apple did not say how it will use Q.ai's technology but said the startup has worked on new applications of machine learning to help devices understand whispered speech and to enhance audio in challenging ​environments.

articles.title: Pentagon clashes with Anthropic over military AI use, sources say
articles.summary: The discussions represent an early test case for whether Silicon Valley, in Washington's ‌good graces after ‌years of tensions, can sway how U.S. military and intelligence personnel deploy increasingly powerful AI on the battlefield.

articles.title: F&O Talk | Nifty cracks 5% in 11 days: Is this just the beginning of a deeper slide? Sudeep Shah weighs in
articles.summary: Indian equity markets closed the week on a subdued note, impacted by profit-booking and foreign investor outflows. Global trade concerns and domestic earnings disappointments weighed on sentiment. Analysts suggest caution ahead of the Budget, with Nifty facing resistance and broader markets showing weakness. PSU banks are outperforming private peers.

articles.title: Blue Machines AI sets new benchmark by engaging in unscripted hour-long debate on national TV
articles.summary: In a groundbreaking national television debut, Indian AI platform Blue Machines AI successfully engaged in a 60-minute unscripted news debate. This historic man-versus-machine contest showcased the AI's ability to handle complex discussions, interruptions, and rapid topic shifts, demonstrating enterprise-grade reliability and governance for India's burgeoning tech sector.

articles.title: India government sets deadline for financial bids for IDBI, says report
articles.summary: India sets February 5 deadline for financial bids in IDBI Bank divestment, with Fairfax Financial Holdings, Emirates NBD and Kotak Mahindra Bank approved as bidders for a 60.7% stake sale.

articles.title: Tension mounts in Gulf as Iran vows powerful response, US strike odds rise
articles.summary: Tensions stay high around the Strait of Hormuz as Iran signals readiness through military posturing, while US forces maintain presence and markets price geopolitical risk.

articles.title: Relaxo Footwears Q3 FY26 profit falls 20% to ₹26.5 crore despite stable revenue
articles.summary: Relaxo Footwears posted steady topline performance in the December quarter, supported by strong traction in organised retail, e-commerce, and large-format stores. However, higher expenses weighed on profitability, prompting the company to emphasise a balanced focus on growth and margins going forward.

articles.title: Ashoka Buildcon's net profit jumps over three-fold; revenue falls 23%
articles.summary: Ashoka Buildcon's Q3 profit jumped to ₹2,111.41 crore, despite a 23% revenue drop. Shares of Ashoka Buildcon Ltd ended higher on Friday, January 30, by 3.72% at ₹149.99 on the NSE.

articles.title: Air India AI171 crash probe: AAIB examining aircraft components, ‘nothing ruled out’ yet
articles.summary: Investigators probing the deadly June 2025 Air India Dreamliner crash are continuing a multi-layered assessment of technical systems, cockpit actions, organisational processes and environmental conditions. Sources say the AAIB is closely examining specific aircraft components while following an elimination-based framework, even as speculation over possible pilot-related factors draws scrutiny.

articles.title: Real estate mogul C J Roy found dead in Bengaluru office; suicide suspected
articles.summary: CJ Roy, Founder of Confident Group, was found dead at his Bengaluru office after a gunshot was heard, amid Income Tax Department searches and questioning. Police suspect suicide.

articles.title: Markets swing in uneasy trading after Trump nominates Kevin Warsh to be next Fed chair
articles.summary: Prices are swinging across financial markets as investors try to figure out what President Donald Trump's nominee to be the next Federal Reserve chair will mean for them.

articles.summary: Glenmark Pharmaceuticals posted strong Q3 results with profit and revenue rising over 15% YoY, aided by robust growth in India and North America and sharp operating margin expansion.

articles.title: Kolkata fire: Adhikari leads rally, demands arrest of food chain owners
articles.summary: Adhikari alleged that the ruling Trinamool Congress (TMC) was shielding those responsible for the tragedy and showing insensitivity, claiming that Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee had not visited the site even five days after the incident, while rescue and search operations were still underway.

articles.title: Meet Kevin Warsh — The 17th Federal Reserve Chair picked by Donald Trump
articles.summary: Warsh's vast career spans across the private sector and Capitol Hill, as well as senior roles within the Federal Reserve. He studied public policy at Stanford University, with an emphasis on economics and statistics.

articles.title: New Fed leadership and policy uncertainty to keep markets volatile: Ned Davis strategist
articles.summary: Ed Clissold of Ned Davis Research expects growth to slow later in the year and warns that earnings expectations may be revised lower, increasing the risk of a market pullback.

articles.title: Services exports hit 10% of GDP, reinforce India’s external resilience: Economic Survey
articles.summary: Economic Survey 2026 highlights services exports as a key growth driver for India, with software and consulting leading, rising to 10% of GDP and boosted by global demand and trade agreements.

articles.title: India’s 7% growth outlook supports markets, but economists flag fiscal, trade, and currency risks
articles.summary: India’s near-7% growth outlook supports market sentiment, but economists caution that underlying sectoral fragilities, delayed trade risks and inflation-linked fiscal assumptions will remain key watchpoints for equities, bonds and the rupee.

articles.title: Indian economy shows steady momentum in December, says new monthly economy index by Moneycontrol
articles.summary: Moneycontrol’s Eco Pulse is a composite high-frequency index which aims to measure India’s economic momentum on a monthly basis and provide early signals of changes in the direction of GDP growth.

articles.title: Late to AI, but better placed: Economic Survey says India can skip the costly AI arms race
articles.summary: Its comparative advantage in the AI era, the Survey says, does not lie in building frontier-scale models. Instead, it lies in application-led innovation, the productive use of domestic data, the depth of human capital, and the ability of public institutions to coordinate distributed efforts across sectors.

articles.title: Economic Survey 2026 | FPIs dump equities, rotate into debt amid global risk-off
articles.summary: Economic Survey 2026 | Foreign portfolio investors turned net sellers of Indian equities in Q2 and Q3 FY26, even as debt inflows rose, amid global uncertainty, rupee weakness and elevated US bond yields.

articles.title: India remains fastest-growing major economy for the fourth consecutive year, says Economic Survey
articles.summary: The Survey states that the Gross Value Added (GVA) growth rate for FY26 is placed at 7.3%, reflecting strong growth momentum despite global economic uncertainty. The estimates were released by the Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation (MoSPI) on Thursday, January 29.

articles.title: CEA suggests minimum wage per hour or task for India's gig workers

articles.title: Economic Survey 2026 warns of uncertainties as India attempts to solve AI-labour puzzle
articles.summary: The Economic Survey 2025-26 urges caution on AI in India, citing Yale’s study and uncertainties, despite reassuring short-term evidence for labour-rich economies.

articles.title: Economic Survey 2026 pegs India’s FY27 growth at 6.8-7.2%, outlook remains positive
articles.summary: India’s economy is projected to grow 6.8–7.2% in FY27, with domestic demand continuing to anchor activity, the Economic Survey said. It cautioned that global risks remain elevated amid a fragile external environment.

articles.title: India Defence Budget 2026: What to expect
articles.summary: India’s Defence Budget 2026 may see cautious growth amid geopolitical tensions, indigenisation push, and rising demand for modernisation.

articles.title: Ex‑Amazon employee says work experience is now a liability, announces Congressional bid
articles.summary: Amazon lays off 16,000 globally; veteran AI leader says experience is now a liability, criticizes global labor practices, and announces Congressional run to fix “rules” around work.

articles.title: India considers expansion in definition of start-ups to promote innovation in deep-tech
articles.summary: Sources explained that the expanded definition of start-ups aims to incentivise more companies to innovate.

articles.title: Ravi Kota chosen as next HAL CMD; to take charge in May 2026
articles.summary: Ravi Kota, known as the LCA man, is set to become HAL Chairman in May 2026, leading key Tejas fighter jet milestones and driving India's defence manufacturing self-reliance.

articles.title: Elon Musk's SpaceX to consider merger with Tesla: claim reports
articles.summary: SpaceX is exploring a merger with Tesla or xAI, aiming to unite rockets, Starlink, X, and Grok AI before a major IPO, Bloomberg and Reuters report. Tesla shares rose 3 percent after the news.

articles.title: Air India orders 30 more Boeing jets, converts 15 Airbus A321s to XLR variant
articles.summary: Air India to expand its fleet with 30 new Boeing aircraft, converts 15 Airbus A321neo to A321XLR, and signs a Boeing 787 Component Services Program at Wings India 2026. This follows the airline's 2023 order for 220 Boeing aircraft, bringing its total commitment with the manufacturer to 250 planes.

articles.title: Money rushes into emerging markets at record levels despite firm dollar
articles.summary: Global Liquidity Tracker shows GEM fund inflows hit $11 billion as de-dollarisation trade intensifies, while DXY stays range-bound. India and commodity funds see record inflows despite mixed trends.

articles.title: Gold rates fall from all-time highs: Why prices dropped today
articles.summary: Gold fell below ₹5,000 per ounce as investors eyed a hawkish Federal Reserve chair, but remains set for its strongest monthly gain since 1999 amid global uncertainty and safe-haven demand.

articles.title: Silver price crash: Rates on MCX in 15% lower circuit as commodities sell-off globally
articles.summary: Why silver is falling today: Analysts attributed the decline to profit-booking following recent all-time highs and a rebound in the US dollar.

articles.title: Ajit Pawar funeral in Baramati: Sons perform last rites; Amit Shah, Fadnavis attend
articles.summary: Ajit Pawar, 66, died on the morning of Wednesday, January 28, when a chartered Learjet carrying him crashed near the Baramati airstrip. Politicians across parties and states have reached Baramati to attend Ajit Pawar's last rites.

articles.title: How Ajit Pawar shaped Maharashtra politics: Key milestones and roles
articles.summary: Ajit Pawar, Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister, died in a plane crash near Baramati, ending a decades-long career marked by political influence, finance expertise, and NCP leadership. Baramati was both the beginning and the end of his political journey.

articles.title: Remembering Ajit Pawar: Baramati strongman and architect of coalition power
articles.summary: Ajit Pawar, Maharashtra’s Deputy Chief Minister, died at 66 in a plane crash at Baramati. His career spanned major political shifts, controversies, and a split from Sharad Pawar.

articles.title: TN polls: Only TVK has guts to take on 'evil force' DMK and 'corrupt' AIADMK, says Vijay
articles.summary: Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam's Vijay positioned the Tamil Nadu Assembly elections 2026 as a democratic battle, unveiling the whistle symbol and challenging DMK, AIADMK, and BJP influence.

articles.title: Telecom services suspended in parts of J&K's Kishtwar amid anti-terror operation
articles.summary: The Jammu and Kashmir government has suspended 2G to 5G mobile data in parts of Kishtwar from January 29 to 30, citing security concerns as forces continue anti-terror operations in the district.

articles.title: Watch: IAF Mi-17V5 helicopters drop 12,000 litres on high-altitude Lohit Valley wildfire
articles.summary: The Indian Air Force deployed Mi-17V5 helicopters to drop 12,000 litres of water on a major wildfire in Arunachal Pradesh’s Lohit Valley, battling flames in rarefied high-altitude terrain.

articles.title: Watch: Two paragliders crash into Tehri lake; SDRF rescues pilots
articles.summary: The two pilots lost control mid-air during an acrobatic manoeuvre, leading them to plunge into the lake.

articles.title: Delhi SWAT commando death: Husband told brother ‘I am killing your sister’ on call; all to know
articles.summary: A Delhi Police SWAT commando, four months pregnant, died after an alleged assault by her husband in West Delhi. A call recording, dowry harassment claims and a murder investigation have emerged.

articles.title: Wildfire tears through Nagaland’s Dzukou valley for 3rd day, reaches Manipur’s highest peak Mount Esii
articles.summary: The Dzukou Valley is a well-known and picturesque location with seasonal wildflowers, rolling green hills, and the rare Dzukou lily. It is extremely combustible due to the dry winter weather, particularly the dry grass and bamboo that cover a large portion of the terrain.

articles.title: Martyrs’ Day in India: Key dates, history and why it is observed
articles.summary: India observes Martyrs’ Day on 30 January and 23 March to honour Gandhi and revolutionary heroes, with a nationwide two-minute silence and quiet events in schools and public offices.

articles.title: Kolkata Anandpur fire: Wow! Momos' Manager and Deputy Manager arrested, toll rises to 25
articles.summary: The West Bengal government has announced a compensation amount of ₹10 lakh to the families of the deceased in the accident.

articles.title: Ajit Pawar plane crash: Aviation Minister seeks Fadnavis support for speedy probe; what we know so far
articles.summary: Prove reveals that Baramati is an ‘uncontrolled airfield’ without an instrument landing system, with traffic advisories typically provided by flying training instructors.

articles.title: Delhi traffic advisory for Jan 30: Avoid these routes for Martyr's Day event
articles.summary: Delhi Police will enforce traffic diversions near Rajghat on January 30 for the Martyr’s Day event attended by dignitaries. Key junctions and roads will face restrictions from 9 am to 12 noon.

articles.title: Rain and snowfall to batter Jammu and Kashmir, Himachal; light showers likely in Delhi-NCR
articles.summary: Rain and snowfall with thunderstorms and strong winds are expected over Jammu and Kashmir, Ladakh, Gilgit, Baltistan, and Muzaffarabad from January 30 to February 1.

articles.summary: Authorities are relying on DNA profiling to identify victims after charred and skeletal remains were recovered from the gutted premises, while forensic findings suggest the blaze may have started in a decorator’s warehouse before spreading to an adjacent momo manufacturing unit.

articles.summary: The Economic Survey highlights rising compute costs and GPU shortages as AI bottlenecks in India, but sees late-mover advantage in application-led innovation and resource-efficient AI systems.

The factory space will be used to build robots.

articles.title: From stability to strategic indispensability: What the Economic Survey sets up for Budget Sunday

The collapse is attributed to heavy seasonal rains weakening the ground.
